nodes.bodyText: could you specify which versions need the layer? was it < 2.2?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -26,8 +26,8 @@
     <!-- The following paths need to be defined here as well as in the parent pom so that mvn can -->
     <!-- run properly from sub-project directories -->
     <build.path>${project.parent.parent.parent.parent.basedir}/build</build.path>
-    <!-- 2.2.0 client works with a wide range of HMS, from 1.0 to 3.1 -->
-    <hive-metastore.version>2.2.0</hive-metastore.version>
+    <!-- 2.3.7 client needs a compatibility layer to work with lower versions -->

nodes.bodyText: done
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -26,8 +26,8 @@

nodes.bodyText:
Should this be private?
Also, the second field should be @Nullable I think?
done
If the shim was not created, compatibility will be null. Is that ok?
it is ok, because we check for null in the call.
I'm not sure what this code is doing. Could you explain it, and add a comment?
added a comment
Can you improve this message?
done
Can you make this message more specific? I'm not sure what the user should do with that message.
done
The second parameter should be @Nullable
done

These info logs could be spammy, since it would log for each invocation of those calls. Should we just cache this info and proactively use the compat method since that decision won't change over time. Then, we can log it when cache the method decision.
reduced log level
Everything will go through Proxy and reflection now? That will have an overhead for any HMS interaction?

I am not worried about the performance overhead at all. these calls are going to be dominated by network cost.
according to http://ordinaryjava.blogspot.com/2008/08/benchmarking-cost-of-dynamic-proxies.html, dynamic proxies are about 1.63x of a normal method call, which is almost instant.
Is this safe? We are grabbing a field by name, of the hdfs client?

If this constructor fails, it will be caught at the higher level and we would behave as if there is no compatibility layer.
This reflection allows us to access the  thrift client and issue hive 2.2 compatible requests.
FYI: other places where reflection is used, there is the risk of failed reflection as well. In those cases, we catch throwable and fall back to the default behavior of the base client.
add the fieldName to the message
done
Why do we have to set and then unset each time?
you are right, we don't need to unset
Should this be saved/cached?
i don't think there is a lot of value in caching these objects, mainly because the cost of reflection is going to be minimal compared to the network cost of these thrift calls.
Does the name of the method already imply the compatibility shim? If not, can we be explicit in the message that we are using the compatibility shim?
done
Thanks for adding the compatibility part, but I think the method name is also useful. Could you add back the method name?
done
